result.execSummary:
The defendant Russell J. Mann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Payable as follows:  $50.00 due on or before May 1, 2016 and on the same day thereafter each month, until paid in full.    Failure to pay any part of the court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.  $15.00 payment plan fee added.
Sentence to start on or before April 4, 2016 at 6:00 p.m.  EMP allowed according to jail rules.  Credit, if any, to be determined.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

cancel per SO inmate sheet; custody JASO 2/1/17
From SPD David Wilson regarding sentence credit   (Per C.O. on 5/6 - Judge already saw this letter)
From ADA Inlow to Judge opposing any sentence credit.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Wilson.  Plead no contest to Count BJ as a repeater, in 16CM5.  Dismiss, but read in DC charge in 15CM312.  Joint recommendation for jail time.    Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the count he is pleading to.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Repeater allegation confirmed.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Count 1 as charged in 16CM5.  Dismiss, but read in DC charge in 15CM312 .  State recommended 30 days jail to commence immediately.  Defense requesting 20 days jail.  Report date 4/29.  Court ordered:  25 days jail, starting by 6 pm 4/4/16. EMP allowed according to jail rules.  CC.  $50/mo 5/1.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.  Credit, if any, to be determined.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.

Pre-trial conference at 02-03-2016 10:00 am.
Status conference at 02-22-2016 03:00 pm.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Wilson. Waive reading of the complaint.  Defendant stood mute.  Track with 15CM312.  NGP entered by the court.   PTC 2/3 and STC 2/22.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and without counsel.  Defendant received the complaint.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties.  He understood.  He spoke to SPD.  He qualified.  Adjourned until Attorney Wilson appears.
